calculate_total_revenue.routine_definition:
BEGIN
  RETURN QUERY
  SELECT 
    COALESCE(SUM(b.total_amount), 0) as booking_revenue,
    COALESCE(SUM(vb.total_amount), 0) as venue_revenue,
    COALESCE(SUM(s.amount), 0) as sponsor_revenue,
    COALESCE(SUM(b.total_amount), 0) + 
    COALESCE(SUM(vb.total_amount), 0) + 
    COALESCE(SUM(s.amount), 0) as total_revenue
  FROM events e
  LEFT JOIN bookings b ON e.id = b.event_id
    AND (p_start_date IS NULL OR b.created_at >= p_start_date)
    AND (p_end_date IS NULL OR b.created_at <= p_end_date)
  LEFT JOIN venue_bookings vb ON e.id = vb.event_id
    AND (p_start_date IS NULL OR vb.created_at >= p_start_date)
    AND (p_end_date IS NULL OR vb.created_at <= p_end_date)
  LEFT JOIN sponsorships s ON e.id = s.event_id
    AND (p_start_date IS NULL OR s.created_at >= p_start_date)
    AND (p_end_date IS NULL OR s.created_at <= p_end_date)
  WHERE (p_event_id IS NULL OR e.id = p_event_id);
END;

get_dashboard_metrics.routine_definition:
DECLARE
        result JSON;
        user_uuid UUID := (auth.uid())::uuid;
      BEGIN
        IF user_uuid IS NULL THEN
          RETURN '{"error": "Not authenticated"}'::json;
        END IF;
        
        CASE user_role
          WHEN 'organizer' THEN
            SELECT json_build_object(
              'total_events', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT e.id), 0),
              'total_revenue', COALESCE(SUM(b.total_amount), 0) + COALESCE(SUM(vb.total_amount), 0),
              'total_tickets_sold', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT t.id), 0),
              'upcoming_events', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN e.date > NOW() THEN e.id END), 0),
              'venue_bookings', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT vb.id), 0),
              'sponsorship_revenue', COALESCE(SUM(s.amount), 0)
            ) INTO result
            FROM events e
            LEFT JOIN bookings b ON e.id = b.event_id
            LEFT JOIN venue_bookings vb ON e.id = vb.event_id
            LEFT JOIN sponsorships s ON e.id = s.event_id
            LEFT JOIN tickets t ON e.id = t.event_id
            WHERE e.organizer_id = user_uuid;
            
          WHEN 'designer' THEN
            SELECT json_build_object(
              'total_bookings', COALESCE(COUNT(db.id), 0),
              'total_earnings', COALESCE(SUM(db.amount), 0),
              'events_participated', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT ed.event_id), 0),
              'average_rating', COALESCE(AVG(dr.rating), 0)
            ) INTO result
            FROM designer_profiles dp
            LEFT JOIN designer_bookings db ON dp.id = db.designer_id
            LEFT JOIN event_designers ed ON dp.id = ed.designer_id
            LEFT JOIN designer_reviews dr ON dp.id = dr.designer_id
            WHERE dp.user_id = user_uuid;
            
          WHEN 'model' THEN
            SELECT json_build_object(
              'total_bookings', COALESCE(COUNT(mb.id), 0),
              'total_earnings', COALESCE(SUM(mb.payment_amount), 0),
              'events_participated', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT mb.event_id), 0),
              'casting_applications', COALESCE(COUNT(ca.id), 0)
            ) INTO result
            FROM model_profiles mp
            LEFT JOIN model_bookings mb ON mp.id = mb.model_id
            LEFT JOIN casting_applications ca ON mp.id = ca.model_id
            WHERE mp.user_id = user_uuid;
            
          ELSE
            SELECT json_build_object(
              'total_tickets', COALESCE(COUNT(t.id), 0),
              'total_spent', COALESCE(SUM(b.total_amount), 0),
              'events_attended', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT t.event_id), 0),
              'upcoming_events', COALESCE(COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN e.date > NOW() THEN t.event_id END), 0)
            ) INTO result
            FROM tickets t
            LEFT JOIN events e ON t.event_id = e.id
            LEFT JOIN bookings b ON t.booking_id = b.id
            WHERE t.user_id = user_uuid;
        END CASE;
        
        RETURN COALESCE(result, '{}'::json);
      END;

get_event_metrics.routine_definition:
DECLARE
          result JSON;
      BEGIN
          SELECT json_build_object(
              'total_bookings', COUNT(DISTINCT b.id),
              'total_revenue', COALESCE(SUM(b.total_amount), 0),
              'tickets_sold', COALESCE(SUM(bi.quantity), 0),
              'check_in_rate', 
                  CASE 
                      WHEN COUNT(b.id) > 0 
                      THEN ROUND(100.0 * COUNT(b.checked_in_at) / COUNT(b.id), 2)
                      ELSE 0 
                  END,
              'avg_order_value', 
                  CASE 
                      WHEN COUNT(b.id) > 0 
                      THEN ROUND(AVG(b.total_amount), 2)
                      ELSE 0 
                  END
          ) INTO result
          FROM bookings b
          LEFT JOIN booking_items bi ON bi.booking_id = b.id
          WHERE b.event_id = event_uuid
          AND b.status = 'confirmed';
          
          RETURN result;
      END;

get_tables_with_column.routine_definition:
BEGIN
      RETURN QUERY
      SELECT t.table_name::text
      FROM information_schema.columns t
      WHERE t.column_name = $1
      AND t.table_schema = 'public';
    END;

handle_new_auth_user.routine_definition:
begin
  -- Create profile skeleton
  insert into public.profiles (id, email, phone, full_name, profile_visibility)
  values (
    new.id,
    new.email,
    new.phone,
    split_part(coalesce(new.email, new.phone, new.id::text || '@placeholder.local'), '@', 1),
    'private'
  )
  on conflict (id) do nothing;

  -- Give default attendee role
  insert into public.user_roles (user_id, role)
  values (new.id, 'attendee'::public.app_role)
  on conflict (user_id, role) do nothing;

  -- Initialize empty preferences
  insert into public.user_preferences (user_id)
  values (new.id)
  on conflict (user_id) do nothing;

  return new;
end

sync_clerk_user.routine_definition:
DECLARE
      v_profile_id UUID;
    BEGIN
      INSERT INTO profiles (
        clerk_id,
        clerk_user_id,
        clerk_email,
        clerk_first_name,
        clerk_last_name,
        clerk_image_url,
        email,
        full_name,
        role
      ) VALUES (
        p_clerk_id,
        p_clerk_id,
        p_email,
        p_first_name,
        p_last_name,
        p_image_url,
        p_email,
        COALESCE(p_first_name || ' ' || p_last_name, p_email),
        'attendee'
      )
      ON CONFLICT (clerk_id) DO UPDATE
      SET
        clerk_email = EXCLUDED.clerk_email,
        clerk_first_name = EXCLUDED.clerk_first_name,
        clerk_last_name = EXCLUDED.clerk_last_name,
        clerk_image_url = EXCLUDED.clerk_image_url,
        email = EXCLUDED.email,
        full_name = EXCLUDED.full_name,
        updated_at = NOW()
      RETURNING id INTO v_profile_id;
      
      RETURN v_profile_id;
    END;
